text: Does anyone have any pointers or experience in HubSpot with it stripping out certain characters from preview text? I recently sent an email campaign and the preview text included a comma in a number ($20,000 for example) and it keeps the comma in the Email tool but removes it in the email test/actual email. Has anyone else experienced this issue? Is this a bug with HubSpot or a feature to help prevent being flagged as spam for including a large number like 20,000?
Which email client are you using to test this?
Ahh yes. It's a Gmail issue specifically. <https://github.com/hteumeuleu/email-bugs/issues/103>

I’ve implemented this for clients before, and to my knowledge, it requires the use of a secondary form and an associated workflow. I’m uncertain of what products/product tiers are required for the workflow, however.

You *can* add this secondary form to the subscription preferences system page by way of editing the template, and I recommend doing so, to ensure it’s shown to users who click the “Manage Subscription Preferences” link in a marketing email.

Would really love some additional clarity on exactly what counts as a “CRM hit” in this context.

My understanding is that it’s limited to the use of the `crm_object`, `crm_objects`, and `crm_associations` functions — is that correct? Is there anything else that counts as a CRM hit that we should be aware of?

I’d also love to know if this limit is exclusive to CRM calls, or if it also applies to HubDB calls?
